intro: Benstonea celebica, commonly known as the Celebes benstonea, is a flowering plant native to the Moluccas in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its botanical features include opposite leaf arrangement and the presence of milky sap. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and less-studied species.
